reviews.review_msg: Hands down best English prof at SFU. He taught me how to write an essay and took the time to answer every painful and repetitive question I had. Although I did not receive the best grade in this class, I definitely learned a lot from him!!!

From my experience (102/347), Mr. Everton truly cares about his students. Yes, he is a hard (yet fair) marker, but he gives detailed feedback and is more than willing to work with you to improve your writing. He has high standards, but it is only because he knows you can reach them. My papers went from a C- to an A while in his classes; its doable.

I did fairly well in his class. He is a good lecturer, as in he knows his stuff. In all honesty, he belittles you and acts like he is the son of Einstein. Wrong, he is far from it. He marks very hard and is picky. GPA downer. If you're interested in theory, take his course, he overkills it. He is the abject. Stay away. You've been warned

By far my favourite prof.  His lectures are so organized and informative while still remaining funny and engagaing.  I would walk out of each class knowing that I had learned a lot.  My advice to other students: take a class with Michael Everton!

Amazing. Seriously amazing. In ten years he'll be Ivy League. I have never had a teacher this dedicated and passionate. If you are at SFU, it would be a crime never to have a class with Everton. He could probably make me like Milton - he's that good. A tip for survival: If you don't know how to use a semicolon, JUST DON'T USE IT.

Michael Everton is a really wonderful professor. He is passionate, straightforward, and very flexible with assignments, due dates, etc. Lectures were always fun, and he really pushes students to follow through on their opinions... my favourite prof at SFU so far!
He is a great prof! Insightful and really nice.  You can't help but be interested about what he has to say.
